page.title: 20DEEPING ST.JAMES FORAGE
page.content: The forage merchant in the village deals mainly in straw and hay.Some of which he gets from his own land but most of which he buys from other farm- ers in the area. Two men work for the merchant.They have four large lorries for transport- ing the bales as far away as Cheshire and Staffordshire.Three of the lorries can pull an extra trailer if the load is very large.When fully laden these lorries can carry about seven tonnes of hay. They deliver to Army Training Centres,Manchester Police Stables, Riding Schools,and to farms.Some of the loads go to a company where it is processed into cattle pellets.A small percentage is also used for thickening soups.Another buyer is a large paper mill which makes a coarse paper out of the straw.
